original.context: Boston ( ) is a town and small port in Lincolnshire, on the east coast of England. It is the largest town of the wider Borough of Boston local government district. The borough had a total population of 66,900, at the ONS mid 2015 estimates, while the town itself had a population of 35,124 at the 2001 census. It is due north of Greenwich on the Prime Meridian. Kirton End is a hamlet in the civil parish of Kirton in the Boston district of Lincolnshire, England. It lies on the B1391 road, 4 mi south-west from Boston, and 1.5 mi north-east from Kirton.
original.question: According to the 2001 census, what was the population of the city in which Kirton End is located?
original.primary_question: According to the 2001 census, what was the population

adv_sent.distractor: The population of Massachusetts is 6.8 million, according to the 2001 census.
adv_sent.distractor1: The population of Los Angles is 3.967 million.
